intro: Euryloma obbata, commonly known as the obbata sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a characteristic feature of the sedge family. Euryloma obbata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
